page.title: 06Population and Movement
page.content: A survey of almost 200 local people found that 60% had lived in their present homes over 10 years and that the average length of residence was 13 years. Over 40 years 4.9% 5 years 19.6% 30 years 8.7% 2 years 13.1% 20 years 13.1% 1 year 4.9% 15 years 12.5% <1 year 3.2% 10 years 19.6% Asked where they had previously lived 26% had moved within our block,a further 47% had moved from other parts of Gateshead,7.5% from other parts of Tyneside,8% from Co.Durham,only 3.16% from other parts of the North_East and Cumbria,3.7% from other parts of Britain and 2.5% from abroad. 36% of Whickham respondents had moved inside the block,while 60% in Lobley Hill came from other parts of Gateshead.
